info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 10 at 10:17PM CDT until June 11 at 12:30AM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
At 1017 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 1 to 2 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Eldorado, Roosevelt, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084, Adams, Us-277 Near The Sutton-Schleicher County Line and I-10 Near The Sutton-Kimble County Line.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Rocky Creek, Frog Creek, Salina Creek, Poor Hollow, Maynard Creek, West Fork Maynard Creek, Little Paint Creek, Terrett Draw, Kickapoo Creek, San Saba River, North Llano River, Bois d'Arc Creek, South Concho River, Epps Creek, Dry Creek, North Valley Prong, Dry Llano River, Dry Devils River, Eightmile Draw, Middle Copperas Creek, West Copperas Creek, Pecan Creek, McCarty Creek, Middle Valley Prong and Millers Branch.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1230 AM CDT WEDNESDAY FOR WESTERN KIMBLE, EASTERN SCHLEICHER, EASTERN SUTTON AND SOUTH CENTRAL TOM GREEN COUNTIES

area.areaDesc: Kimble, TX; Schleicher, TX; Sutton, TX; Tom Green, TX
